A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
So disappointing and so disrespectful. I'm trying to embrace the latest trilogy\, but TLJ has made it so hard. So many missed opportunities\, involving both old and new characters. It's a film of nothing. Rey's parents\, nothing. Snoke\, nothing. That sub-plot\, nothing. Character development\, nope sorry. Even the big final duel is...nothing.
Mark Hamill got it right when he said he fundamentally disagrees with their decisions involving Luke. It is just wrong.
The plot holes are ridiculous. Why does the purple haired lady have to stay on the ship again? To look out the window and then punch a few commands into a console?! Get a droid to do It\, or if you have to kill some one get Admiral Akbar to do it. At least we are emotionally invested in him. Another wasteful and disrespectful death for him.
The humour is misplaced. Luke milking an alien is further humiliation. There is just so much wrong with this film. Rian and Kathleen Kennedy might as well have looked direct into the camera and said "It's over for you guys. Star Wars is dead. Long live Disney Wars"
